str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Left, left behind, the remainder, the rest, the others. Masculine plural of a derivative of leipo; remaining ones.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
(passively) untrustworthy (person), or incredible (thing).
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From sun and eudokeo; to think well of in common, i.e. Assent to, feel gratified with.
To inhabit, dwell, indwell. From oikos; to occupy a house, i.e. Reside; by implication, to cohabit.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
